titlestmt.titleproper: Birds of North America project records 1987-2000
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: Birds of North America project records

bioghist.p: In two centuries of American ornithology, The Birds of North America (BNA) is only the fourth comprehensive reference covering the life histories of North American birds. Following in the footsteps of Wilson, Audubon, and Bent, BNA makes a quantum leap in information beyond what these historic figures were able to provide. Edited by Drs. Alan Poole and Frank Gill, this series provides detailed scientific information (18 volumes, 18,000 pages in total) for each of the 716 species of birds nesting in the USA and Canada. The print version of BNA was completed in 2002, a joint 10 year project of the American Ornithologists' Union, the Cornell Lab of Ornithology, and the Academy of Natural Sciences.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records from the compilation and publication of The Birds of North America. Materials include: annotated typescript drafts of species entries; correspondence related to text and editorial matters; negatives and mock-ups of illustrations; and printed drafts of species entries. The collection also includes published versions of species entries 1 through 80; several versions of the project's guidelines for authors; and brochures and other promotional material for the project.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
